rev.comment: changed title of section from "Launch" to "Availability"
rev.diff:
Line 48: Line 48:
The DROID RAZR by Motorola is the thinnest smartphone in the world at only 7.1 mm thick at it's thinnest point (it does, however, have a "bump" on top that's approximately 11.1mm thick.) and includes a 4.3 inch Super [[Active-matrix OLED|AMOLED]] Advanced display, covered in a [[Gorilla glass]] screen and a [[Kevlar]] back plate. It is powered by an [[Texas Instruments OMAP#OMAP 4|OMAP 4430]] [[system-on-chip|SoC]] with dual 1.2 GHz [[ARM Cortex-A9 MPCore|ARM Cortex-A9]] processor cores. Its 8 megapixel rear facing camera can record 1080p HD videos. It comes with 1 GB of RAM and runs version 2.3.5 of the Android OS.<ref>{{cite web |url= http://mobilesmug.com/news/1-phones/1116-motorola-droid-razr-finally-unveiled-making-its-way-to-rogers-and-verizon|title= Motorola DROID RAZR finally unveiled, making its way to Rogers and Verizon|date= 19 October 2011|publisher= MobileSmug|accessdate=19 October 2011 }}</ref>
The DROID RAZR by Motorola is the thinnest smartphone in the world at only 7.1 mm thick at it's thinnest point (it does, however, have a "bump" on top that's approximately 11.1mm thick.) and includes a 4.3 inch Super [[Active-matrix OLED|AMOLED]] Advanced display, covered in a [[Gorilla glass]] screen and a [[Kevlar]] back plate. It is powered by an [[Texas Instruments OMAP#OMAP 4|OMAP 4430]] [[system-on-chip|SoC]] with dual 1.2 GHz [[ARM Cortex-A9 MPCore|ARM Cortex-A9]] processor cores. Its 8 megapixel rear facing camera can record 1080p HD videos. It comes with 1 GB of RAM and runs version 2.3.5 of the Android OS.<ref>{{cite web |url= http://mobilesmug.com/news/1-phones/1116-motorola-droid-razr-finally-unveiled-making-its-way-to-rogers-and-verizon|title= Motorola DROID RAZR finally unveiled, making its way to Rogers and Verizon|date= 19 October 2011|publisher= MobileSmug|accessdate=19 October 2011 }}</ref>
â
==Launch==
+
==Availability==
The phone is expected to launch in [[India]] in the first week of November at a price of {{INR}}32,000.<ref>http://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/tech/personal-tech/gadgets-special/Motorola-Razr-coming-to-India-next-week/articleshow/10556150.cms</ref>
The phone is expected to launch in [[India]] in the first week of November at a price of {{INR}}32,000.<ref>http://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/tech/personal-tech/gadgets-special/Motorola-Razr-coming-to-India-next-week/articleshow/10556150.cms</ref>
